intro: Phacelia cicutaria var. heliophila, commonly known as the sun-loving phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The variety heliophila is distinguished by its preference for full sun exposure compared to other varieties of Phacelia cicutaria.
